file_content.text: I see they rolled out the red carpet.
Someone needs target practice.
Tyth's gauntlet. A favorite tactic among the Knights of Zakuul.
When I was in charge, the knights had better aim.
Bullseye!
Indo Zal, reporting for duty! Full of vigor and raring to serve the Alliance...
...though that last shot may have dislocated my shoulder.
I knew we could count on you. Now give the signal, and send the rebels to join the fight.
Perfect timing, Indo.
My pleasure, Outlander.
Not to worry. Give me a sling and a nightcap, and I'll be right as rain.
As for the rebels, I'm afraid they've turned sour on you.
As for the rebels, I have good news...
I don't care if your arm's hanging on by a thread, I need your rebels. Now.
Less whining, more fighting.
I'm afraid it's language like that which turned them sour on you.
They were shouting awful things. Something about the Outlander using them as cannon fodder, and plans to blast you into a million pieces.
The rebels are your friends. Can't you talk any sense into them?
Fix this, Indo.
I may have exaggerated our friendship. At any rate, they made it quite clear they're done with the both of us.
I saved your friends from Vaylin's beast. Where's their gratitude?
This wasn't part of the deal.
It was butchered with those who died at Vaylin's festival. Their words, not mine.
I'm going to fit your backstabbing friends with shock collars and pick up where Vaylin left off.
They'll pay for betraying me.
A just punishment. But first you really must watch the skies for incoming explosives.
They're beginning the attack! May Aivela save you, Outlander!
Point taken, Outlander.
My compatriots borrowed artillery from the local militia. They'll begin raining fire any moment now, I'm sure of it.
You and your friends will all have a place in the Alliance once this is over.
Good work, Indo.
I'm getting all misty.
The sooner they open fire, the sooner we breach the tower and take the throne.
They'd better pull through.
They're targeting your foes as we speak.
Don't stop until the battlefield's littered with my enemies.
Blast them to pieces.
A fitting end, to be sure.
Now if you'll excuse me, I must plan for your ascension to the throne. It will be my grandest party yet!
A lesser man would've broken our deal. I did send your rebels to die at Vaylin's festival.
I wasn't sure you'd show up.
I would never betray a dear friend. As for the other rebels... I'm afraid they've turned sour on you.
Find a medic and patch yourself up. We can't have you fainting in the middle of my coronation party.
Take care of yourself.
